q: with Howard Stern the shock jock asked the late night host "how much longer are you doing this, really?" To which David Letterman responded "I don't know. Maybe two more years?" Two more years and then you exit? Howard Stern continued. "That's why we got ta beat Jay!" You can see the moment for yourself at about the 2:40 mark in this video: If David Letterman were to retire in 2013,

Detroit News Washington Bureau The Environmental Protection Agency and Chrysler will announce a new research and development project next week in Ann Arbor. EPA Administrator Lisa Jackson will join Chrysler Group CEO Sergio Marchionne to announce a research and development project to explore and evaluate an innovative drivetrain technology for light duty vehicles, the EPA said in a statement. all three patients on Monday. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand told US television Sunday she had visited Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her "doing great" and "making progress every day." Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's "Meet The Press" program.
